content.body: Orama is allowed to attend the TC39 plenary next week, right?

littledan: (RE `Array.prototype.group`) I think the answer to "how do we choose web-compatible `Array.prototype` method names?" is obvious but we just don't want to accept it: stop trying to choose good names
content.formatted_body: littledan: (RE Array.prototype.group) I think the answer to "how do we choose web-compatible Array.prototype method names?" is obvious but we just don't want to accept it: stop trying to choose good names

content.body: Michael Ficarra: There's something in common with the `group` name as the previous `global` name: people searched for the name and found too many results, so it was too much to look through, and they sort of assumed it was compatible (but without reporting all of that logic to the committee in advance). In the future, if a search yields that sort of result, I think the next step is to choose something else.
content.formatted_body: Michael Ficarra: There's something in common with the group name as the previous global name: people searched for the name and found too many results, so it was too much to look through, and they sort of assumed it was compatible (but without reporting all of that logic to the committee in advance). In the future, if a search yields that sort of result, I think the next step is to choose something else.

content.body: bad/verbose names are much less risky, but we *want* the name to be good, so we take the risks anyway
content.formatted_body: bad/verbose names are much less risky, but we want the name to be good, so we take the risks anyway

content.body: I think for Array methods in particular, we should just use things that we can demonstrate to be pretty unique
Array methods have been found to be uniquely risky unlike anything else
yes, we need an especially high bar for Array prototype method names
evidence of compatibility, not just lack of evidence of incompatibility
well, I'd like that if someone could provide it, but I'm not sure what such evidence would look like
what advice would you give to a new delegate who wants to take on the Array grouping project?
